poem:
Withdrawn Whispers

In Baku's shadowed halls,  
voices of the absent lie—  
a silence spun by denial,  
while far away, the earth ignites  
in unsung protests of heat.  
The wind sways, a knowing witness,  
to dreams unbirthed, where hope  
collapses like falling leaves  
colored by an unseen autumn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Argentina withdraws negotiators from Cop29 summit Argentinian negotiators representing the government of the climate science denier Javier Milei have been ordered to withdraw from the Cop29 summit after only three days, adding to concerns about the stability of the Paris agreement. More than 80 representatives from the South American country are in Baku, Azerbaijan, for two weeks of negotiations about climate finance for the energy transition. Argentina’s far-right leader has previously called the climate crisis". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
